posts.content:
I'm joining Arelith with a big group of friends and we've mostly all chosen our preferred playstyles. I have a general idea on how builds go, but I don't know every last detail, and I'm aware that the smallest difference can be a major flaw in a max level build. My playstyle is lots of speed, preferrably with no weapon (unarmed). I like the quarterstaff too, but I've been told it's a really bad weapon on Arelith. Monk is the best choice for this playstyle, but I'm willing to try something wierd or different if that's possible. I've played Arelith before, and I know dying while grinding for exp can be really punishing (yeah, we're grinders okay >> But we do lots of roleplaying, even when grinding!), so maybe a class that's less vulnerable early in levels would work? If it's too sub-optimal, I can still go with the normal Monk build. As for races, I can play a human, a halfling, or an elf/half-elf. (I hate orcs and dwarves, they're ugly). For classes, I'll play anything as long as I get to have loooots of AC, but like I said, I prefer to be unarmed (which means no shield) so it'll most likely be a Monk build. Hope those who are willing to help out will find it to be a simple task.

[EDIT]: By the way, something good in PVP! Specifically against any two-handed classes

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
My first question is:  self-buffing or existing off what combat enhancements fall in your lap?  (i.e. AB & damage potential)  Self-buffing effectiveness on a server is guided largely by resting opportunities and how comfortable a player is with spellcasting.
My second question is:  how valuable is UMD on Arelith?
My third question is: stealth/DEX build or plain STR? Note: DevCrit will probably kick in very late in the build on Arelith if you are seeking that (I am assuming it is still a level 30 cap PW).

Essentially, the only way to deal with high-damage, high-APR STR types (other than throwing Bigby's and IGMS at them) is to hit their weakness: AC.  That means you'll need enough AB to assure lots of hits.  Which leads to something like FTR or CoT levels to boost both BAB and APR.  Locking yourself into unarmed attack means WM is not an alternative to achieve that high AB and crit enhancements. C'est la vie!

Stunning Fist is another alternative if you wear enough WIS gear to raise the DC to an acceptable level.  It is ineffective vs. high CON creatures and crit immunes (like PM10's), however.

The choice between medium race and small race is: small +1AC/+1AB/2d6 dmg vs. medium d20 dmg (@monk16).  There are also some skill advantages with small races. Pick your poison.

posts.author: Metri
posts.content:
1). I don't mind self-buffers, but I don't often play classes that do a lot of spellcasting. I honestly don't mind having low-ish AB either, just as long as it's not complete garbage. To answer your question; I'm more comfortable with non-buffing classes, but I'm willing to use a class with spells so long as it's not an overwhelming amount.
2). UMD is still very valuable on Arelith. No one fights on Arelith without wands. However, I am going to be playing with a large group. Chances are, I won't need it if someone else has it. It's nice to have, but if there's a way I can get more AC by dropping it, I'd prefer to take that path.
3). I'm aware that a Dex build would be simpler. One of my friends, more experienced in building than I am (though still no expert), tells me that this build with Str would be terrible, and impossible. If it's true, then I can go the Dex build. If the Str build actually is possible, maybe we can look at them and compare to see which one I like more?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Metri wrote:
Does that build focus on Fighter early for more feats and survivability? Or more Monk levels early, saving Fighter for epic level range?
It's much less complicated than that.  All that's needed pre-epic is enough fighter levels to get WS and qualify for SD (and consequently ED during epic).  Just keep to the rule of 4's to maximize your BAB.  A pure monk would have less APR than one bumped up to BAB 16 by virtue of 4 levels of any fighter class.  As mentioned previously, we don't have the option of CoT, so fighter is about the only recourse.  This is primarily a race to get to Monk 16 where the unarmed damage reaches its maximum.

In epic, we only need Monk 9/SD 5 for ED so will take ED asap after SD 5.  The split was the easiest part: Monk 16/SD 5 and all the rest in pairs of fighter levels for more feats. 30-21=9 so that is 4 fighter pairs plus a trailer to do as you like... the one that Empyre mentioned but hardly affects the overall build.

Great Cleave is a way for a pedestrian AB (like this one) to get multiple attacks at full BAB and to prevent some AoOs from flankers.  Any version of Cleave is worthless for dueling, however.  WW is another choice (and one not requiring the investment in PA) but I personally find WW hard to manage, timing-wise.  If you are comfortable using it, by all means, go that route by subbing Spring Attack for PA.

The idea that any build can be optimized for both PvM and PvP is a mirage.  PvP has a completely different set of considerations so trying to build a "one-size-fits-every-purpose" toon is plain folly.

Oh, one other point... don't be intimidated by the seemingly anemic HP tally.  This is a Level 30 build.  A full epic total (@40) would be at least 70 HP higher depending on how many addditional fighter levels were incorporated.  If it becomes an issue due to play style like berzerking that gets flanked all the time, yield an AB and sub in two Great CON feats to also grab another Fort save.  An epic dodger shouldn't need near as much HP, though.
